docs.title: Change areas
docs.text: Downscaler 1.0 is ArcGIS Pro tool which has been designed to provide high resolution land cover (LC) change scenarios, based on existing low-resolution LC change models. First, the tool identifies areas susceptible of change at finer resolutions (10m) by comparing rougher baseline and forecasted scenario land cover areas. Once areas of potential change are identified, they are analysed to determine whether they should be changed. This decision is based on expert-provided transition tables.

docs.title: Transition tables
docs.text: The transition table is at the core of the downscaler as it informs the workflow as to which pixels should be modified, and which should remain unaltered.

docs.title: Output
docs.text: Once the transition table is applied to the target raster and pixels are changed accordingly, in order to ensure that the landscape features are realistics, the land cover parcels for the area in question are updated: pixels overlapped by the parcels are recounted to find a majority class, which will be used to re-rasterise the raster dataset.

def main():
    from T1_230313_YearParsing import *
    import argparse
    import sys
    import pandas as pd
    import sklearn.metrics as sk
    import numpy as np
    import os

    os.system('cls||clear')

    int_year = pd.to_numeric(sys.argv[1:][0])
    np.set_printoptions(linewidth=160)

    if (int_year != 2017 and int_year != 2018 and int_year != 2019 and int_year != 2020 and int_year != 2021 and int_year != 2022):
        print("This script only accepts the following values as argument: 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022")
    else:
        print("Process started. Please wait...")

        df_RPA = pd.read_csv("RPA_2p_90p_" + str(int_year) + ".csv")
        df_LUS_exc = year_parsing(int_year)

        #Selecting max 
        df_LUS_max = df_LUS_exc.loc[df_LUS_exc.groupby("NGC_NEW", sort = False)["SUM_AREA_CLAIMED_HA"].idxmax()][["NGC_NEW","LAND_USE_CODE_NEW","SUM_AREA_CLAIMED_HA"]]
        # filter out ioc
        df_RPA = df_RPA[df_RPA.RPA_2plus_IoC >= 0.9]
        df_RPA = df_RPA[df_RPA.RPA_2plus_IoC <= 1.1]

        # inner join - select only those that are in both. First rename field names for join
        df_RPA_renamed = df_RPA.rename(columns = {"RPA_2plus_NGC":"NGC_NEW"})
        df_RPA_LUS_J = pd.merge(df_RPA_renamed, df_LUS_max, how = "inner", on = "NGC_NEW")

        print("Calculating Cohen's Kappa for the " + str(int_year) + " dataset")
        y_true = df_RPA_LUS_J["LAND_USE_CODE_NEW"]
        y_pred = df_RPA_LUS_J["crop" + str(int_year)]
        c_m = sk.confusion_matrix(y_true,y_pred, labels = df_RPA_LUS_J["LAND_USE_CODE_NEW"].unique())

        print("The Coehn's Kappa value for the " + str(int_year) + " dataset is " + str(round(sk.cohen_kappa_score(y_true,y_pred),4)))
        print("Accuracy score: " + str(sk.accuracy_score(y_true,y_pred)))
        print(sk.classification_report(y_true,y_pred, zero_division = 0))
        print("Calculating confusion matrix...")
        df_ct = pd.crosstab(y_true, y_pred)
        print(df_ct)
        print("Exporting...")
        df_ct.to_csv("confusion_matrix_" + str(int_year) + ".csv")
        print("The confusion matrix has been saved in the local drive.")
        print("Completed.")

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Continuous Internnet connectivity
  • ArcGIS Pro v3.* with Spatial Analyst, Advanced edition
  • Read/Write permission on the project folders
  • The following 4 files should be stored in the project database and displayed in the Contents view: baseline: 1km, 8 bit unsigned raster file scenario4: 1km, 8 bit unsigned raster file parcels: polygon file cells: 10m, 8 bit unsigned raster file
